title: Gene-edited stem cells show promise against HIV in non-human primates

title_detail.value: Gene-edited stem cells show promise against HIV in non-human primates

summary: Gene editing of bone marrow stem cells in pigtail macaques infected with simian/human immunodeficiency virus (SHIV) significantly reduces the size of dormant 'viral reservoirs' that pose a risk of reactivation.

summary_detail.value: Gene editing of bone marrow stem cells in pigtail macaques infected with simian/human immunodeficiency virus (SHIV) significantly reduces the size of dormant 'viral reservoirs' that pose a risk of reactivation.
